Algebraic manipulation of limits

Some Rules

  1. a+bc=ac+bc\frac{a+b}{c} = \frac{a}{c} + \frac{b}{c}ca+b​=ca​+cb​
  2. a2−b2=(a+b)(a−b)a^2 - b^2 = (a+b)(a-b)a2−b2=(a+b)(a−b)
  3. a3−b3=(a−b)(a2+ab+b2)a^3 - b^3 = (a-b)(a^2 + ab + b^2)a3−b3=(a−b)(a2+ab+b2)
  4. a3+b3=(a+b)(a2−ab+b2)a^3 + b^3 = (a+b)(a^2 - ab + b^2)a3+b3=(a+b)(a2−ab+b2)
  5. a4−b4=(a+b)(a−b)(a2+b2)a^4 - b^4 = (a+b)(a-b)(a^2 + b^2)a4−b4=(a+b)(a−b)(a2+b2)
  6. ax2+bx+c=a(x−r1)(x−r2)ax^2 + bx + c = a(x-r_1)(x-r_2)ax2+bx+c=a(x−r1​)(x−r2​) where r1r_1r1​ and r2r_2r2​ are the roots of the quadratic equation ax2+bx+c=0ax^2 + bx + c = 0ax2+bx+c=0

Reminder of Log rules

  1. log⁡b(xy)=log⁡b(x)+log⁡b(y)\log_b(xy) = \log_b(x) + \log_b(y)logb​(xy)=logb​(x)+logb​(y)
  2. log⁡b(xy)=log⁡b(x)−log⁡b(y)\log_b(\frac{x}{y}) = \log_b(x) - \log_b(y)logb​(yx​)=logb​(x)−logb​(y)
  3. log⁡b(xk)=klog⁡b(x)\log_b(x^k) = k \log_b(x)logb​(xk)=klogb​(x)
  4. log⁡bk(x)=1klog⁡b(x)\log_{b^k}(x) = \frac{1}{k} \log_b(x)logbk​(x)=k1​logb​(x)
  5. log⁡b(bx)=x\log_b(b^x) = xlogb​(bx)=x
  6. log⁡b(1)=0\log_b(1) = 0logb​(1)=0
  7. log⁡b(b)=1\log_b(b) = 1logb​(b)=1
  8. log⁡b(x)=log⁡c(x)log⁡c(b)\log_b(x) = \frac{\log_c(x)}{\log_c(b)}logb​(x)=logc​(b)logc​(x)​
